<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>const APFloat &amp; llvm::sandboxir::ConstantFP::getValueAPF () const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/sandboxir/constant-h/#l00291">291</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/sandboxir/constant-h">Constant.h</a>.

### isExactlyValue() {#a48823e5da12f02df3ea52fc4a6bfcd3d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool llvm::sandboxir::ConstantFP::isExactlyValue (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apfloat">APFloat</a> &amp; V) const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
We don&#39;t rely on operator== working on double values, as it returns true for things that are clearly not equal, like -0.0 and 0.0.

As such, this method can be used to do an exact bit-for-bit comparison of two floating point values. The version with a double operand is retained because it&#39;s so convenient to write isExactlyValue(2.0), but please use it only for simple constants.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/sandboxir/constant-h/#l00316">316</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/sandboxir/constant-h">Constant.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### get() {#a78087dbe0e4c827032abde5ad6a952f7}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Constant &#42; llvm::sandboxir::ConstantFP::get (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sandboxir/type">Type</a> &#42; Ty, double V)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
This returns a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sandboxir/constantfp">ConstantFP</a>, or a vector containing a splat of a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sandboxir/constantfp">ConstantFP</a>, for the specified value in the specified type.

This should only be used for simple constant values like 2.0/1.0 etc, that are known-valid both as host double and as the target format.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/sandboxir/constant-h/#l00267">267</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/sandboxir/constant-h">Constant.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/sandboxir/constant-cpp/#l00091">91</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/sandboxir/constant-cpp">Constant.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### get() {#a479363d750fdfe89eb2b33528c83f124}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Constant &#42; llvm::sandboxir::ConstantFP::get (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sandboxir/type">Type</a> &#42; Ty, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apfloat">APFloat</a> &amp; V)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
If Ty is a vector type, return a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sandboxir/constant">Constant</a> with a splat of the given value.

Otherwise return a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sandboxir/constantfp">ConstantFP</a> for the given value.
